articles.author: Stephen Culp
articles.description: Wall Street notched tentative gains on Monday as market participants looked ahead to the U.S. Federal Reserve's expected decision to leave key interest rates unchanged on Wednesday.
articles.title: Wall Street edges higher as investors eye Fed pause

articles.author: Karen Kwok
articles.description: Bob van Dijk is passing an unsolved problem to his successor. The chief executive of Prosus (PRX.AS), Tencent’s (0700.HK) biggest investor, said on Monday he was stepping down. Interim CEO Ervin Tu can suggest more asset sales to boost shareholder returns. But without a plan for his company’s 25% stake in the $380 billion Chinese e-commerce behemoth, Prosus shares’ discount to the value of their underlying assets will remain the elephant in the room.
articles.title: Prosus CEO exit leaves Tencent elephant in room

articles.author: Matt Spetalnick
articles.description: The Biden administration is preparing to unveil new regulatory measures to allow more U.S. financial support for small private businesses in Cuba, a person familiar with the matter said on Monday.
articles.title: US prepares measures to help Cuban small businesses

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Negotiators for the Writers Guild of America and Hollywood's major studios will resume contract talks on Wednesday to try and end a work stoppage that has disrupted production for more than four months.
articles.title: Striking Hollywood writers, studios to resume negotiations on Wednesday

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Planet Fitness (PLNT.N) is struggling to adapt to a high-interest-rate diet. After 13 years, boss Chris Rondeau on Friday abruptly stepped down from the $4 billion gym chain, sending shares to their lowest level in three years. With growing debt-servicing costs crimping franchisees, the company can’t outrun rising rates unless its next coach reconsiders rock-bottom prices.
articles.title: Planet Fitness races against rate hikes

articles.author: Alex Lawler
articles.description: With oil investors and traders focused on an oil-price rally that has come close to $100 a barrel, some grades of crude oil are already trading above that milestone, highlighting an expectation of tight supply.
articles.title: Will oil hit $100? It already did in some markets

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: Starbucks (SBUX.O) was ordered by a federal judge on Monday to face a lawsuit claiming that several of its Refresher fruit beverages lacked a key ingredient: fruit.
articles.title: Starbucks to face lawsuit claiming its fruit drinks are missing fruit

articles.author: Andrew Mills
articles.description: A Qatari plane waited in Iran on Monday to fly out five U.S. detainees in a swap for five Iranians held in the United States, thanks to a Doha-mediated deal that has also unfrozen $6 billion of Iranian funds.
articles.title: US and Iran to swap detainees after $6 billion unfrozen

articles.author: Howard Schneider
articles.description: U.S. Federal Reserve officials, who have tentatively embraced the possibility they can squelch inflation without a recession, meet this week with an autoworkers strike, a possible federal government shutdown, and a student loan squeeze on consumers posing new risks to that best-case outcome.
articles.title: The Fed wants to cool spending; a strike, a shutdown and student loans may add ice

articles.author: David Shepardson, Ben Klayman
articles.description: The United Auto Workers and Chrysler-parent Stellantis resumed bargaining talks on Monday as a strike against the Detroit Three automakers entered its fourth day.
articles.title: UAW resumes bargaining talks with Chrysler-parent Stellantis
